alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 5:25PM EDT until April 05 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CLARENDON AND SOUTHEASTERN ORANGEBURG COUNTIES... At 524 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles west of Holly Hill, or 8 miles north of Indian Field, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. At 517PM, Orangeburg County EM reported strong rotation near Bowman. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Holly Hill around 535 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Santee, Mill Creek Marina and Campground, Vance, Indian Bluff Recreation Park and Eutawville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 161 and 169. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 100. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately.
